name: zero_add

proof:

name: le_total
statement: theorem le_total (x y : MyNat) : (le x y) ∨ (le y x) := by
proof:
induction x with d hd
  | zero =>
    left
    apply zero_le
  | succ d' =>
    cases y with
    | zero =>
      right
      apply zero_ne_succ
    | succ c =>
      cases hd with
      | inl h =>
        left
        apply le_succ_self
      | inr h =>
        right
        apply le_succ_self
        exact h

name: mul_right_eq_one
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
proof:
cases y with
| zero =>
  rw [mul_zero] at h
  contradiction
| succ n =>
  rw [mul_succ] at h
  have : add (mul x n) x = one := h
  -- Now we need to analyze the equation 'add (mul x n) x = one'.
  -- We know that 'one' is 'succ zero', so we can rewrite it as:
  rw [succ_eq_add_one] at this
  -- This gives us 'add (mul x n) x = add zero one'.
  -- By the property of addition, we can use 'add_right_cancel' to conclude:
  apply add_right_cancel this
  -- Now we need to show that 'mul x n = zero'.
  -- If 'mul x n = zero', then by 'mul_left_ne_zero', we conclude 'x = one'.
  -- Therefore, we have shown that 'x = one'.
  exact this

statement: theorem mul_ne_zero (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (hb : b ≠ zero) : mul a b ≠ zero := by

  case zero =>

    rw [mul_succ a d]

    exact ha

name: mul_eq_zero
statement: theorem mul_eq_zero (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b = zero) : a = zero ∨ b = zero := by
proof:
cases a with
| zero =>
  left
  rfl
| succ n =>
  cases b with
  | zero =>
    right
    rfl
  | succ m =>
    rw [mul_succ] at h
    have h1 : add (mul n b) b = zero := h
    apply add_right_eq_zero.mp h1

name: mul_left_cancel
statement: theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
proof:
have hbc : mul a b = mul a c := h
have h0 : mul a b ≠ zero ∨ mul a c ≠ zero := by
  apply or.inl
  exact ha

have hb : b ≠ zero := by
  intro hb0
  rw [hb0] at hbc
  have h0 : mul a zero = zero := mul_zero a
  exact hbc h0

have hc : c ≠ zero := by
  intro hc0
  rw [hc0] at hbc
  have h0 : mul a zero = zero := mul_zero a
  exact hbc h0

exact (mul_left_ne_zero a hb hc).mp hbc

statement: theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
proof:

| zero =>
  have h1 : mul a zero = zero := mul_zero a

  contradiction

  rw [mul_succ] at h
  rw [h] at h
  have h2 : add (mul a c) a = a := h
  apply add_right_cancel a
  exact h2
